original_data.question: A 52-year-old man is brought to the emergency department for recurrent vomiting that began 5 hours ago. He describes the vomitus as bloody and containing black specks. He drinks 10–12 beers daily and has not seen a physician in 15 years. He appears pale. His temperature is 36.7°C (98.1°F), pulse is 122/min, and blood pressure is 85/59 mm Hg. Physical examination shows decreased radial pulses, delayed capillary refill, multiple spider angiomata, and a distended abdomen. He is oriented to person but not to place or time. Which of the following is most likely decreased in this patient in response to his current condition compared to a healthy adult?

model_response:
The fractional tissue oxygen extraction is decreased in this patient in response to his current condition compared to a healthy adult. The patient is in shock with a low cardiac index and high systemic vascular resistance. The carotid baroreceptor firing activity is decreased in shock. Cardiac inotropy is depressed in heart failure.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human males as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Hospital department responsible for the administration and provision of immediate medical or surgical care to the emergency patient.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Gastrointestinal contents that have returned to the mouth or are ejected beyond the mouth.
A morphologic finding indicating a change in a tissue due to vascular injury or leakage.
A single serving of a beverage; any liquid suitable for drinking.
An alcoholic beverage usually made from malted cereal grain (as barley), flavored with hops, and brewed by slow fermentation.
Occurring or done each day.
Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A clinical manifestation consisting of an unnatural paleness of the skin.
The measure of the level of heat of a human or animal.
The rhythmical expansion and contraction of an ARTERY produced by waves of pressure caused by the ejection of BLOOD from the left ventricle of the HEART as it contracts.
PRESSURE of the BLOOD on the ARTERIES and other BLOOD VESSELS.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
A subjective response indicating that something is or has decreased.
A clinical finding in which a capillary nail refill test returns to pink color in greater than two seconds after pressure is removed. (ACC-AHA)
A hemangioma arising from the retina.
That portion of the body that lies between the THORAX and the PELVIS.

Persons as individuals (e.g., ABORTION APPLICANTS) or as members of a group (e.g., HISPANIC AMERICANS). It is not used for members of the various professions (e.g., PHYSICIANS) or occupations (e.g., LIBRARIANS) for which OCCUPATIONAL GROUPS is available.
The dimension of the physical universe which, at a given place, orders the sequence of events. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 6th ed)
A subjective response indicating that something is or has decreased.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
A state of being, such as a state of health.
